data.enText: able to think quickly; quick to notice things

data.chText: 突然他发觉自己醒了过来，而且高度警觉。
data.enText: Suddenly he found himself awake and fully alert.

data.chText: 两个警觉的科学家发现了这个错误。
data.enText: Two alert scientists spotted the mistake.
aware of sth, especially a problem or danger

data.chText: 我们必须认识到危险的可能性。
data.enText: We must be alert to the possibility of danger.

data.chText: 向…报警；使警觉；使警惕；使戒备
data.enText: to warn sb about a dangerous or urgent situation

data.chText: 邻居很快向紧急情况服务部门报了警。
data.enText: Neighbours quickly alerted the emergency services.

data.chText: 楼下的响声使他警觉，他坐起来打开灯。
data.enText: Alerted by a noise downstairs, he sat up and turned on the light.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)
动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: to make sb aware of sth

data.chText: 他们已意识到价格可能继续上涨。
data.enText: They had been alerted to the possibility of further price rises.
a situation in which people are watching for danger and ready to deal with it

data.chText: 警方警告公众要警惕可疑包裹。
data.enText: Police are warning the public to be on the alert for suspicious packages.

data.chText: 5 000多名士兵已处于（全面）戒备状态。
data.enText: More than 5 000 troops have been placed on (full) alert .
a warning of danger or of a problem

simple_means.memory_skill: al + ert 能量，活力；工作 → 有活力 → 提醒

ex.chText: 作决定应谨防仓促草率。
ex.enText: You should beware of making hasty decisions.

synonyms.bx: 主要用于祈使句，通常后接介词 of。

ex.chText: 她提醒丈夫注意喝酒的种种危害。
ex.enText: She alerted her husband to the dangers of drinking.

ex.chText: 我们经常提醒公众注意控制污染的必要性。
ex.enText: We often alert the public to the need for pollution control.

synonyms.bx: 指提醒某人对某事物引起重视，常用于 alert sb to sth 结构。

tr: an automatic signal (usually a sound) warning of danger
a warning serves to make you more alert to danger
condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action
example: bombers were put on alert during the crisis

tr: warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
example: We alerted the new neighbors to the high rate of burglaries

tr: engaged in or accustomed to close observation
example: caught by a couple of alert cops
alert enough to spot the opportunity when it came
constantly alert and vigilant, like a sentinel on duty
alive to what is going on
awake to the dangers of her situation
was now awake to the reality of his predicament
a brisk walk in the park

value.def: If you are alert, you are paying full attention to things around you and are able to deal with anything that might happen.

example.ex: We all have to stay alert...
example.tran: 我们大家都必须保持警惕。

example.ex: He had been spotted by an alert neighbour.
example.tran: 一个警觉的邻居发现了他。

value.tran: 警觉的；警惕的；留神的；机敏的

value.def: If you are alert to something, you are fully aware of it.

example.ex: The bank is alert to the danger.
example.tran: 银行充分意识到了危险。

value.tran: 充分意识到…的;完全感觉到…的

value.def: An alert is a situation in which people prepare themselves for something dangerous that might happen soon.

example.ex: Due to a security alert, this train will not be stopping at Oxford Circus.
example.tran: 由于安全戒备的原因，该次列车在“牛津街口广场”站将不停留。

value.def: If you alert someone to a situation, especially a dangerous or unpleasant situation, you tell them about it.

example.ex: He wanted to alert people to the activities of the group...
example.tran: 他想提醒人们小心该团体的活动。

example.ex: I was hoping he'd alert the police.

value.tran: 向…报警；使警觉；使警惕；使注意

value.def: If soldiers or police are on alert, they are ready to deal with anything that may happen.

example.ex: Soldiers and police have been put on alert.
example.tran: 士兵和警方都已进入警戒状态。

value.tran: 处于警戒状态;保持戒备

value.def: If you are on the alert for something, you are ready to deal with it if it happens.

example.ex: They want to be on the alert for similar buying opportunities.
example.tran: 他们希望随时掌握有关类似购买机会的信息。

trans: 提醒某人某事；使...警觉；使...警惕
密切注意着，随时准备着
紧急戒备状态；紧急警报

rootsaffixes.indicate: = energy, to work 能量, 活力；工作
rootsaffixes.title: erg(o), ert

partsOfSpeech.dec: al + ert 能量，活力；工作 → 有活力 → 提醒
an 无 + erg 能量，活力；工作 + y 表状态 → 无力
en 使 + erg 能量，活力；工作 + etic 有…性质的 → 充满活力的
en 使 + erg 能量，活力；工作 + ize 使… → 给予能量
en 使 + erg 能量，活力；工作 + y 表名词 → 能量；活力
ex 出 + ert 能量，活力；工作 → 发出能量 → 发挥
in 不 + ert 能量，活力；工作 → 无活动的，惰性的
in 不 + ert 能量，活力；工作 + ia 某种病 → 惰性；惯性
in 不 + ert 能量，活力；工作 + ial …的 → 不活泼的；惯性的
syn 共同 + erg 能量，活力；工作 + ic …的 → 共同活动的 → 协同的
